intro: Ayenia aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden ayenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright orange to red flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Ayenia aurantiaca is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in well-drained soils.
